credit control.translation[0].definition: actions by a business to make sure that its customers can pay and can pay on time
A £1.5 million charge was made for bad debts; credit control procedures have now been strengthened.
actions by a bank to make sure that it only lends to those who can repay their loans and that payments are made on time
Strong credit control and loan discipline are the best tools for reducing a bank’s credit risk.
